channel.title: Little Bro Scared
channel.description: Ok my little bro saw the movies ( The Ring, Scream , Grudge) And Now He's Scared As hell. He crys and screams all night so how do i make him get non scared. PS:( Hes 11 And A Half Lol)

item.title: Little Bro Scared
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“ThatOneServer, post:32, topic:173926”]Teach him to laugh when somebody gets hurt in the movies.

To me it is funny when somebody does.[/quote]
Make him watch Terminator. The entire trilogy has plenty hilarious moments [as does the show], however it it sad in some parts

item.title: Little Bro Scared
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I don’t have experience with this, but dogs that are scared shouldn’t be given attention when they are scared. Now this probably is different with humans, but really, don’t go to him when he is screaming, and don’t let him sleep with you. This will get him used to it, and if he likes it he will abuse it. What you could do is watch a movie with him, and point out some things that obviously aren’t real.

Read full topic

item.title: Little Bro Scared
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

I recommend you explain to him how the movies are made. It will kill the magic, but it will also kill the scare. For instance, if he watches Terminator, and he is scared about the part where The Terminator cuts open his arm to check his pistons, simply show him a doll, and say they used make up or eyeliner [or coloured syrup to be more realistic] to make the blood. Understanding how it works will help with this sort of thing.
Also

goatee:

Hug him? Let him get over it? Let him sleep on the floor in your room? Hug him?

Hugs do help, and letting him sleep on the floor in your room is not considered sexual in any way, if that is why you responded in that fashion.

Read full topic
